item.title: [Python] Useful when debugging with TouchDesigner
item.description: ## debug() instead of print() Although print() is the output method used in Python, in TouchDesigner you can use the function debug() instead of where print() is available. The debug() can see the output as well as where and on which line of which operator it was called. This is useful in most cases when debugging with Touch Designer. Comparison of print and debug Troubleshooting_in_TouchDesigner#Command:_debug CrashAutoSave for files that cannot be opened or have initial failure Sometimes I write an infinite loop, or something I don’t know causes the file to crash or not open.

item.title: [Python] Asynchronous communication only with Touch Designer
item.description: ## Introduction TouchDesigner (TD) can execute python script, If a process such as HTTP communication takes a long time, it will be hardened until the process is completed. At this time, the timeline of the whole TD also stops and the drawing is not updated, so In order to prevent it, I decided to communicate asynchronously. If you just want to get the value asynchronously, you may use node etc.
